fixes.name: Delta Down All CCY 6M
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR Condition =
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "4 Month" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "4 Month Swap" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "5 Month" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "6 Month Swap" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "6 Month" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "6 Month Swap" ||
    (
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Market Subtype] = "Major Curve" &&
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days] > 91 &&
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days] <= 183
    )
RETURN
IF(
    Condition,
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Delta Down T USD] + 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Fix Value T],
    0
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF ... THEN ... ELSE to DAX using a VAR for the combined condition and IF for the result. All field references were transformed to the table-qualified form 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[ColumnName]. The logic preserves the original OR list of TERM_LABEL checks plus the Market Subtype and Risk Date # of Days range check; when true returns Delta Down T USD + Fix Value T else 0.
